text:
Ryan Gosling has got his eye on a role in the next Indiana Jones film, although Harrison Ford might need some convincing.

When E! News asked Gosling whether he had asked Ford about starring in the fifth Indiana Jones film he said: "I'm working on it man… easy." He then jokingly added: "You just blew it for me."

It looks as though Gosling, who has just starred alongside Ford in Blade Runner 2049, isn't quite done working with his childhood hero - even if he did manage to "walk into" Harrison's fist on set.

But what did Ford have to say about the potential casting? "I'm trying to wrap my head around that. Too soon."

We'll be honest, it's not the most positive reaction we've ever heard, but then again it is Harrison Ford.

Speaking to ET recently, Gosling said that Ford's films meant a lot to him, so it was great to see firsthand "how it's done".

''He's been creating all these seminal movie experiences for all of us. He's the one person who hasn't got to experience that, because he's been too busy making them. And so to have a window into how he does that was really great.''

The fifth Indiana Jones will be dropping in 2020, so far both Harrison Ford and Steven Spielberg have been slated to return, but no official casting announcements have been made.
title: Ryan Gosling Say He Is "Working On" Getting 'Indiana Jones' Role

og.title: Ryan Gosling Is "Working On" Harrison Ford To Get 'Indiana Jones' Role
